markdownRemark.html:
Introduction

Rich Hicky gave an insightful talk on the role of type. He presents incisive commentary on the use of exhaustive typing enforced (and praised) by languages like Haskell. A part of the issue strict typing reveals, as he outlines for us, is that programming at a high-level is the process of automating tasks and procedures that exist in a domain.

Programs excel at automating scripted, repetitive tasks. With the advent of more advanced techniques such as Machine Learning we see computers automating more fuzzy tasks. In a sense, programs can now create programs. care to keep around, operate inside of some kind of domain.
